message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
@Entity
public class Person {
    @Id
    @GeneratedValue
    private Long id;
    @OneToMany(cascade = CascadeType.ALL, fetch = FetchType.EAGER)
    @OrderBy("timestamp DESC")
    @JoinColumn(name = "PERSON_ID")
    private List<Activity> activities;

    public List<Activity> getRecentActivities() {
        return activities.stream()
            .limit(5)
            .collect(Collectors.toList());
    }
    // other setters, getters, etc.
}
<<<explanation>>>: Unfortunately, Hibernate does not provide a way to limit the size of a collection directly in the mapping. However, you can create a method in your entity that returns the most recent 5 activities. This method uses Java 8's Stream API to limit the activities list to the most recent 5. Note that this will still fetch all activities from the database, but only return the most recent 5. If you want to limit the number of activities fetched from the database, you would need to use a query with a limit clause.
